docs.lead_paragraph: A new report that reverses earlier findings suggests that men who identify themselves as bisexual may indeed experience arousal from both men and women.

headline.main: No Surprise for Bisexual Men: Report Indicates They Exist
headline.print_headline: No Surprise for Bisexual Men: Report Indicates They Exist

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Biological Psychology finds men who identify themselves as bisexual may indeed experience arousal from both men and women, contradicting widely publicized and controversial 2005 study.
docs.snippet: A new report that reverses earlier findings suggests that men who identify themselves as bisexual may indeed experience arousal from both men and women.

docs.lead_paragraph: Guidance from many leading medical organizations on the subject of routine, nontherapeutic circumcision of infant boys has been equivocal.

headline.seo: Circumcising Infant Boys Is No Longer a Foregone Conclusion
headline.main: Circumcise or Don’t? Quandary for Parents
headline.print_headline: Circumcise Or Don’t? Quandary For Parents

docs.abstract: Leading medical organizations have given ambiguous guidance related to routine, nontherapeutic circumcision.
docs.snippet: Guidance from many leading medical organizations on the subject of routine, nontherapeutic circumcision of infant boys has been equivocal.

docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty-six million Americans have chronic kidney disease, and avoiding complications depends heavily on how well patients care for themselves.

headline.seo: Doctors Sharpen Their Message on Kidney Disease
headline.main: Doctors Hone Message on Kidney Disease
headline.print_headline: Doctors Hone Message on Kidney Disease

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column notes incidence of complications from kidney disease, which affects 26 million Americans, is largely related to how well patients care for themselves.
docs.snippet: Twenty-six million Americans have chronic kidney disease, and avoiding complications depends heavily on how well patients care for themselves.

docs.lead_paragraph: A “crazy idea that just might work” wins a $1 million Gates Foundation grant.
docs.abstract: Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation donates $1 million to fund research on whether microwaves can be used to safely kill malaria parasites in blood.
docs.snippet: A “crazy idea that just might work” wins a $1 million Gates Foundation grant.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers say Toxoplasma gondii twists rats’ instincts, making them lose their fear of cats — the parasite’s ideal host — by stimulating neurons normally engaged in sexual attraction.

headline.seo: Toxoplasma Parasite Hijacks Rats’ Arousal Circuitry, Study Finds
headline.main: To Get to Cats, Common Parasite Hijacks Rats’ Arousal Circuitry
headline.print_headline: To Get to Cats, Common Parasite Hijacks Rats’ Arousal Circuitry

docs.abstract: Study published in journal PLoS One finds parasite Toxoplasma gondii manipulates sexual instincts of host rats, causing them to lose their fear of cats.
docs.snippet: Researchers say Toxoplasma gondii twists rats’ instincts, making them lose their fear of cats — the parasite’s ideal host — by stimulating neurons normally engaged in sexual attraction.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you have grains and legumes on hand — especially quick-cooking ingredients like bulgur, quinoa, rice and lentils — you’ll always have the basis for a healthy meal.

headline.main: Summer Dishes With Grains and Beans
headline.print_headline: Summer Dishes With Grains and Beans

docs.snippet: If you have grains and legumes on hand — especially quick-cooking ingredients like bulgur, quinoa, rice and lentils — you’ll always have the basis for a healthy meal.
